sentences.en: At first I scoffed at the notion.
sentences.cn: 刚开始我对那种想法嗤之以鼻。

sentences.en: He had a sudden notion to visit all his relatives.
sentences.cn: 他心血来潮,突然想去拜访他所有的亲戚.

sentences.en: He has a notion that I'm cheating him.
He has no notion of what I mean.
I haven't the faintest notion what you're talking about.
sentences.cn: 我对于你所讲的话一点儿也不懂.

sentences.en: She had a notion that the share market would rise.
sentences.cn: 她认为股票市场将兴起.

sentences.en: She had no notion what he meant.
sentences.cn: 她根本不明白他是什么意思。

sentences.en: She latched on to your notion.
Some people have the erroneous notion that one can contract AIDS by giving blood.
sentences.cn: 一些人错误地认为献血会让人感染艾滋病。

sentences.en: The notion that art should be controlled by intellectuals sickened him.
sentences.cn: 他讨厌艺术应由知识分子所掌控的观点。

sentences.en: The notion that blacks comprise a problem is at the core of racist reasoning.
sentences.cn: 黑人总爱惹事这一观念是种族主义论断的核心。

sentences.en: The President is attempting to dispel the notion that he has neglected the economy.
sentences.cn: 有人认为总统忽视了经济，总统正试图消除这种看法。

sentences.en: The very notion of price competition is foreign to many schools.
sentences.cn: 价格竞争这个概念对于许多学校都很陌生。

sentences.en: Their relationship turned the standard notion of marriage on its head.
sentences.cn: 他们的关系完全颠覆了传统的婚姻观念。

sentences.en: They espoused the notion of equal opportunity for all in education.
sentences.cn: 他们赞同在教育方面人人机会均等的观念。

sentences.en: Where he got that singular notion I just can't think.
sentences.cn: 我真想不出来他从哪来的那种奇怪念头。

words.tran_cn: 概念性的；想像的；抽象的；不切实际的

trans.tran_cn: 概念，观念，意见，见解，奇想，打算
